hanzi-su-wiki:
踏

Значения

Наступать, топтать; идти, вступать; стоять, опираться

Мнемоника

Справа — невнятное бормотанье 曰, похожее на журчание воды 水. В целом — первые шаги 足 ребёнка под его лепет.
purpleculture_pinyin:
tà
to tread; to stamp; to step on; to press a pedal; to investigate on the spot
ступать; штамповать; наступить; нажать на педаль; расследовать на месте

tā
see 踏实
см. 踏实
rtega_mnemonic:
踏踏RSstep on, trample, tread on, walk
  • walk with feet 𧾷 on things you don't notice because you babble 沓
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 沓 indicates the sound; 足 (foot) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
践踏 [ jiàn tà ]: to trample
脚踏实地 [ jiǎo tà shí dì ]: to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy; steady and serious character
大踏步 [ dà tà bù ]: in big strides; (fig.) in giant steps
踏板 [ tà bǎn ]: pedal (in a car, on a piano etc); treadle; footstool; footrest; footboard
踩踏 [ cǎi tà ]: to trample on
踏实 [ tā shi ]: firmly-based; steady; steadfast; to have peace of mind; free from anxiety; Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
踏踏实实 [ tā tā shí shí ]: steady; steadfast
踏实苦干 [ tā shi kǔ gàn ]: down-to-earth effort (idiom)
踏破门槛 [ tā pò mén kǎn ]: to wear out the doorstep (idiom); to crowd at sb's door
心不踏实 [ xīn bù tā shi ]: uneasy; upset
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 足 [ zú ] foot; to attain, to satisfy; enough
    • 沓 [ tà ] connected, joined; repeated
heisig_chinese_memo: You have to watch your step when moving your leg on a watery day. You might slip and the busy crowd will trample you.
heisig_constituent: step, wooden leg, mouth, stop, footprint, wednesday, boots, water, sun, day
heisig_story: The meaning of this character is virtually identical with that of the last frame. Be sure to come up with distinct connotations suggested by phrases in which each is commonly used. Wooden leg . . . water . . . sun.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: step, trample, carry through, appraise, evade payment
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: шаг, топтать, проводить, оценивать, оплата Evade
koohiiStory1: You have to watch your step when moving your leg on a watery day.
koohiiStory2: So, we´ve walked on the moon, but it´s going to take a pirate with a wooden leg, with a huge supply of cooling water to land on the sun and take that "one small step for a man".
jp_example_words:
踏まえる(ふまえる): to be based on, to have origin in
踏切(ふみきり): railway crossing, level crossing, starting line, scratch, crossover
踏む(ふむ): step on
jp_readingExamples: 踏まえる (ふ.まえる), 踏む (ふ.む)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You soak each foot in water before going out in the sun to take your first step. Stepping on the ground when it's been baking in the hot sun can burn your feet, so you're careful to make them wet with water before stepping outside even once.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine each step on hot, sun-baked asphalt. The water under your feet sizzles, leaving steaming footprints where you stepped from.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Each step you take brings you closer to とうきょう. Unfortunately, the sun keeps getting hotter, meaning you have to take breaks between steps more often, to get your feet wet with even more water. But you're determined to reach とうきょう, no matter how many steps it takes.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Each step is taking you closer to とうきょう. Don't forget that, no matter how hard it seems, don't lose your motivation to keep stepping forward toward your goal. ♡
Ru_Meaning: step, trample, carry through, appraise, evade payment
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), 日 (день), 水 (вода), 足 (нога)
Ru_trainchinese:
tà: (глаг) ступать на, топтать; направляться куда-то (для проведения осмотра)
tā: (графема) используется в слове 踏实
Kanshudo_mnemonic: your foot (⻊) has shoes (沓) for stepping on
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You have to watch your step when moving your leg on a watery day. You might slip and the busy crowd will trample you.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " foot ", " strike ", the original meaning is the foot on the ground, that is, step on. "Jade Pian‧ Foot": "Tread on, foot on the ground." Jia Sixie of the Northern Wei Dynasty "Qi Min Yaoshu‧ Kind of Kwai": "Foot smashing makes firmness level."

" Tread " can mean kick. "The Book of Han-The Legend of Prince Liu Shehu": "The man from Shanyang, Zhang Fuchang, was a soldier and opened the door with his feet."

" Tread " can also mean field surveys and inspections. "The History of the Yuan Dynasty·Criminal Law Chronicle One": "It is a crime for all counties and counties to fail to apply for disasters when they are outdated, or if they do not apply for the truth, and if they do not censor the officials according to the time."

" Treading " also means striding. Ming Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion‧ Futan": "They don't even know that the official office is easy to step on."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " foot " and " pounding ", the original meaning is to touch the ground, that is, step on.
humanum_full_description:
從「足」，「沓」聲，本義為足著地，即踩。《玉篇‧足部》：「踏，足著地。」北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧種葵》：「足蹋使堅平。」

　　「踏」可表示踢。《漢書‧戾太子劉據傳》：「山陽男子張富昌為卒，足蹋開門。」

　　「踏」還可表示實地查勘、察看。《元史‧刑法志一》：「諸郡縣災傷，過時而不申，或申不以實，及按治官不以時檢踏，皆罪之。」

　　 「踏」也表示跨步。明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧腐嘆》：「他們都不知官衙可是好踏的。」
humanum_short_description: 從「足」，「沓」聲，本義為足著地，即踩。

從「 足 」，「 沓 」聲，本義為足著地，即踩。《玉篇‧足部》：「踏，足著地。」北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧種葵》：「足蹋使堅平。」 「 踏 」可表示踢。《漢書‧戾太子劉據傳》：「山陽男子張富昌為卒，足蹋開門。」 「 踏 」還可表示實地查勘、察看。《元史‧刑法志一》：「諸郡縣災傷，過時而不申，或申不以實，及按治官不以時檢踏，皆罪之。」 「 踏 」也表示跨步。明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧腐嘆》：「他們都不知官衙可是好踏的。」
From the sound of " foot", " strike", the original meaning is the foot on the ground, that is, step on. "Jade Pian‧ Foot": "Tread on, foot on the ground." Jia Sixie of the Northern Wei Dynasty "Qi Min Yaoshu‧ Kind of Kwai": "Foot smashing makes firmness level." " Tread" can mean kick. "The Book of Han-The Legend of Prince Liu Shehu": "The man from Shanyang, Zhang Fuchang, was a soldier and opened the door with his feet." " Tread" can also mean field surveys and inspections. "The History of the Yuan Dynasty·Criminal Law Chronicle One": "It is a crime for all counties and counties to fail to apply for disasters when they are outdated, or if they do not apply for the truth, and if they do not censor the officials according to the time." " Treading" also means striding. Ming Tang Xianzu's "The Peony Pavilion‧ Futan": "They don't even know that the official office is easy to step on."

Go to the scene in person: take a look. Reconnaissance. Step check. To visit.

tà, tā
tà
1) топать ногой; притопывать, отбивать ногой ритм; ступать, наступать; давить
连踏而唱 несколько раз топнуть (задавая ритм) и запеть
踏足(脚) наступать ногой, давить ногами
2) ступать по, наступать на; попирать, растаптывать, давить
踏地 ступать по земле
踏雪 ходить по снегу
3) отстукивать, отмерять ногой
踏节 отбивать ритм
4) лично осматривать, обследовать на месте
踏查 расследовать на месте
5) скамеечка для ног; приступка; подножка
6) педаль, ножной привод; ножной
踏车 колесо для подъёма воды с ножным приводом
7) подошвы туфелек; обувь
tā см. 踏实
Radicals: 足, 水, 日  (foot, water, sun)
Meaning Mnemonic
You soak each foot in water before going out in the sun to take your first step. Stepping on the ground when it's been baking in the hot sun can burn your feet, so you're careful to make them wet with water before stepping outside even once.
Imagine each step on hot, sun-baked asphalt. The water under your feet sizzles, leaving steaming footprints where you stepped from.
Reading Mnemonic
Each step you take brings you closer to とうきょう. Unfortunately, the sun keeps getting hotter, meaning you have to take breaks between steps more often, to get your feet wet with even more water. But you're determined to reach とうきょう, no matter how many steps it takes.
Each step is taking you closer to とうきょう. Don't forget that, no matter how hard it seems, don't lose your motivation to keep stepping forward toward your goal. ♡
